channel.title: BBC News - Scotland

item.title: SNP-Green deal could be confirmed on Friday
item.description: An agreement would see Greens enter national government for the first time anywhere in the UK.

item.title: Police Scotland firearms officer 'didn't mean to discriminate'
item.description: Insp Keith Warhurst said he had "an epiphany" when he realised his email about female officers had been construed as sexist.

item.title: Rangers 1-0 Alashkert: Alfredo Morelos strike gives 10-man Ibrox side narrow lead
item.description: Ten-man Rangers avoid a sobering draw at home to Alashkert as Alfredo Morelos' strike keeps them on course for the Europa League group stage.

item.title: Andy Murray brands East Kilbride tennis court a 'shambles'
item.description: The Scots tennis champion said a council-run weed-strewn court in East Kilbride was a "shambles".

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Where are the latest cases?
item.description: A daily update on the number and location of coronavirus cases in Scotland.

item.title: Denis Law: Man Utd and Scotland legend diagnosed with dementia
item.description: Scotland legend and former Manchester United forward Denis Law is diagnosed with dementia.

item.title: Drink driver caused death of teen friends in Fife crash
item.description: Teenagers Connor Aird and Ethan King died as a result of the collision caused by Logan Russell.

item.title: Ex-Rangers administrators Duff and Phelps in £25m legal action against Crown
item.description: Ex-Rangers administrators Duff and Phelps claims it suffered reputational damage due to misconduct in public office.

item.title: Scottish pupils could face 'treadmill' of tests in exam plan
item.description: Teachers warn pupils may have to take "qualification-level" assessments as part of Covid exam contingency plans.

item.title: Bike hire scheme set to end in Edinburgh
item.description: Serco, which has run the initiative in Scotland's capital since 2018, will not renew its contract with the council.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: NHS Borders extends surgery suspension
item.description: NHS Borders says it is "truly sorry" as it cancels routine operations for a further two weeks.

item.title: Covid: More than 40 people isolating after Orkney football tournament
item.description: More than 40 people are forced to self-isolate after a Covid outbreak following the tournament in Orkney.

item.title: Bridge of Weir murder bid driver jailed after retrial
item.description: Don Templeton was involved in the shooting of a car dealer at a farm in 2017.

item.title: Five eagles found dead in Western Isles
item.description: Three were discovered in Harris and two in Lewis but police do not believe the deaths are connected.

item.title: Afghan refugee fled to Glasgow with family to escape Taliban torture
item.description: A man who worked as an interpreter for the British Army tells of his relief at being resettled in Glasgow.

item.title: Scotch whisky exports show signs of recovery
item.description: But the industry says there is "still has some way to go", after Covid-19 and US tariffs hit exports.

item.title: Man aged 77 dies after falling from scaffolding in Peterhead
item.description: The man - named locally as George Forbes - was pronounced dead in Aberdeenshire.

item.title: Eileen Barrott murder: Husband detained in Scotland
item.description: Police have been searching for 54-year-old Mark Barrott since Mrs Barrott's death on Sunday.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: How have the rules changed?
item.description: Scotland's levels system of restrictions have come to an end - but what does that mean people can do?

item.title: Covid: Is Scotland lagging behind on vaccine certificates?
item.description: A digital "passport" has been rolled out across the EU - so why does Scotland use a paper system?

item.title: Is the coronavirus pandemic over at last?
item.description: As Scotland loosens most of its remaining restrictions, is the devastating pandemic finally at an end?

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Your questions answered on life after level zero
item.description: Readers have been sending in their questions about what the ending of more Covid rules means for them.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Are young people slowing the vaccine drive?
item.description: Concerns have been raised about vaccine uptake among younger adults, but are they less likely to want a jab? Here, we examine the statistics.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: Film buff rescues more than 20,000 VHS tapes set for dump
item.description: A video shop owner travelled from Liverpool to Dundee to pick up the massive haul from a collector.

item.title: 'Linda would be heartbroken for Afghanistan's women'
item.description: Scots aid worker Linda Norgrove was killed in Afghanistan 10 years ago and a women's rights charity was set up in her name.

item.title: What is Gers and how is it calculated?
item.description: The annual constitutional battle over the official economic statistics is set to resume.

item.title: Soldier son's Afghanistan sacrifice was 'all for nothing'
item.description: The mother of a Scottish soldier killed in Afghanistan says her son wanted to make a difference - but his death was in vain.

item.title: Five things we know from Scotland's alcohol death figures
item.description: Is the big jump in alcohol deaths last year a surprise or does it follow the trend?

item.title: Could Scots be guaranteed a minimum income?
item.description: The government is to start work on plans for an income guarantee scheme aimed at wiping out poverty in Scotland.

item.title: Is a new oil field climate change hypocrisy?
item.description: As Glasgow prepares to host the COP26 climate summit, a new oil field west of Shetland could get the green light.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Why I'm still shielding after level zero
item.description: A study suggests people with physical and mental health conditions are more anxious about restrictions easing.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Back to school - back to normality?
item.description: As Scotland moves into the third academic year affected by Covid, what can pupils and parents expect?

item.title: Shetland’s biggest gig – the day Pulp flew in to Lerwick
item.description: At the height of their fame, the Britpop icons travelled to Lerwick to play a show for just 1,400 fans.

item.title: Mum's 'life-saving' scheme after family suicides
item.description: Seonaid Stallan has set out to support other families after the deaths of her son and sister-in-law.

item.title: Oil: from bonanza to dilemma
item.description: The Cambo oil field has become a symbol of the pressure the UK and Scottish governments face over climate change.

item.title: Scotland's first electric-powered aircraft begins Orkney test flights
item.description: It is hoped the hybrid aircraft could pave the way for inter-island and short-haul flights with greener technologies.

item.title: 'My brother died horrifically - it can't be in vain'
item.description: A woman calls for an inquiry into the death of her brother who was murdered by a newly-released prisoner.

item.title: What would an SNP-Green deal mean for Scotland?
item.description: What could a deal between the SNP and the Greens mean for Scottish government policies and priorities?

item.title: Will Scotland go back to traditional school exams?
item.description: Will Scottish school pupils be studying for traditional exams in 2022, or have things changed for good?

item.title: Film buff rescues more than 20,000 VHS tapes set for dump
item.description: A video shop owner travelled from Liverpool to Dundee to pick up the massive haul from a collector.

item.title: Firefighters tackle early morning blaze in Glasgow city centre
item.description: The Scottish Fire and Rescue Service said that around 45 firefighters were sent to the scene on Wednesday morning.

item.title: Mum of Scots soldier on trauma of Taliban resurgence
item.description: The mother of a Scottish soldier killed in Afghanistan has said she feels "disgusted" watching the deteriorating situation in the country.

item.title: Afghanistan: ‘My family are trapped in the middle of a war’
item.description: Former refugee Abdul Bostani, who fled the Taliban, speaks of his fears for his family in Afghanistan.

item.title: How do we slow down fast fashion?
item.description: The clothes we wear can have a huge impact on the climate, even more so than the aviation industry.

item.title: LASK 1-1 St Johnstone: Scots earn impressive Europa Conference draw in Austria
item.description: St Johnstone earn a respectable Europa Conference League play-off first-leg draw with Austrian club LASK away from home.

item.title: Qarabag 1-0 Aberdeen: Scottish visitors' group hopes still alive despite first-leg defeat in tough conditions
item.description: Aberdeen's Europa Conference League group-stage hopes are still alive despite a first-leg defeat at Qarabag in tough conditions.

item.title: Juninho Bacuna: Rangers sign midfielder from Huddersfield Town for undisclosed fee
item.description: Rangers announce the signing of midfielder Juninho Bacuna from Huddersfield Town for an undisclosed fee.

item.title: Women's Open 2021: Louise Duncan & Georgia Hall impress as Nelly Korda shares lead at Carnoustie
item.description: Scottish amateur Louise Duncan and England's Georgia Hall are one shot off the lead after splendid opening rounds in scoreable conditions at Carnoustie.

item.title: 2020 Paralympics: Gordon Reid on emulating Rangers & the weight of expectation
item.description: Paralympian Gordon Reid on emulating Rangers, the weight of expectation and the drive to better second place.
